dinosaurs.name: Postosuchus
dinosaurs.special_features: Crocodile‐like skull, semi‐erect posture
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Sharp teeth, strong bite
dinosaurs.fossils_found_in: USA (Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, North Carolina)

dinosaurs.name: Eoraptor
dinosaurs.special_features: Small, agile, sharp claws, quick bite
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Sharp teeth, hand claws
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Likely solitary or in small groups

dinosaurs.name: Herrerasaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Long legs, grasping hands, serrated teeth
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Sharp claws, powerful bite, stealth
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Likely solitary or in small groups

dinosaurs.name: Shuvosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Toothless beak, long legs, lightweight agile body
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Speed and agility as defense mechanisms
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Unknown; solitary or in small groups

dinosaurs.name: Fukuiraptor
dinosaurs.speed: Considered a fast and agile predator
dinosaurs.special_features: Hand claws designed for greater agility
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Used sharp claws and teeth to catch prey

dinosaurs.name: Chindesaurus
dinosaurs.diet_type: Carnivore (fed on small animals and insects)
dinosaurs.special_features: Slender body, sharp teeth
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Used sharp teeth and claws to kill prey

dinosaurs.name: Coelophysis
dinosaurs.speed: Likely a fast, agile runner, estimated 40–50 km/h
dinosaurs.special_features: Lightweight body, long tail, sharp teeth
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Speed, sharp teeth and claws

dinosaurs.name: Plateosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Long neck, grasping hands with large claws
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Used large size to intimidate predators

dinosaurs.name: Rauisuchus
dinosaurs.special_features: Large skull, serrated teeth
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Powerful bite with sharp teeth

dinosaurs.name: Dilophosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Twin skull crests, long slender body
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Sharp teeth, claws, speed for ambush
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Possibly solitary or in small hunting groups
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Early theropod related to later large carnivores

dinosaurs.name: Compsognathus
dinosaurs.speed: ~64 km/h, one of the fastest dinosaurs
dinosaurs.special_features: Small, lightweight body; long tail for balance
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Fast and agile; sharp teeth for catching small prey
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Possibly solitary or in small groups

dinosaurs.name: Cryolophosaurus
dinosaurs.diet_type: Carnivore (likely preyed on smaller dinosaurs and other prehistoric animals)
dinosaurs.special_features: Distinctive cranial crest, possibly used for display or dominance behaviors
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Sharp teeth and claws for hunting; likely used speed and ambush tactics
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Unclear; may have been solitary or lived in small groups

dinosaurs.name: Allosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Large skull with serrated teeth, strong legs, three-fingered claws
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Powerful bite, sharp claws, ambush tactics

dinosaurs.name: Apatosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Long neck, whip-like tail, massive body structure
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Large size as deterrent; possible use of tail as a whip

dinosaurs.name: Camarasaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Shorter neck than some sauropods, spatulate teeth for dense vegetation
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Large size as main deterrent; tail possibly used defensively
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Likely lived in herds or family groups

dinosaurs.name: Brachiosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Long neck, front legs longer than hind legs (giraffe-like posture), large nasal openings atop the head
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Enormous size as deterrent; possible use of tail or stomps for defense
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Likely lived in herds or family groups

dinosaurs.name: Diplodocus
dinosaurs.special_features: Extremely long neck and tail, whip-like tail, small head with peg-like teeth
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Large size as deterrent; possible use of tail as a whip

dinosaurs.name: Stegosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Bony plates along the back and four tail spikes (thagomizer)
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Spiked tail used as a weapon against predators
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Related to other stegosaurs such as Kentrosaurus

dinosaurs.name: Pachycephalosaurus
dinosaurs.diet_type: Herbivore (likely fed on leaves, fruits, and seeds)
dinosaurs.speed: Estimated moderate runner, possibly reaching up to 24 km/h
dinosaurs.special_features: Thick domed skull up to 25 cm thick, small leaf-shaped teeth, bipedal posture
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Possibly used its thick skull to ram rivals or in defense
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Uncertain; may have lived in small groups or been solitary
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Member of Pachycephalosauridae, closely related to other dome-headed dinosaurs like Stygimoloch and Dracorex

dinosaurs.name: Microceratus
dinosaurs.diet_type: Herbivore (likely fed on low-growing plants such as ferns and cycads)
dinosaurs.special_features: Small size, lightweight body, beaked mouth for cropping vegetation; likely no large horns
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Relied on speed and agility to escape predators
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Possibly lived in small groups or herds
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: One of the earliest known ceratopsians, related to later larger species like Protoceratops and Triceratops

dinosaurs.name: Gallimimus
dinosaurs.diet_type: Omnivore (likely ate plants, animals, insects, and eggs)
dinosaurs.special_features: Long legs for running, toothless beak, long neck, large eyes
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Relied on speed and agility to escape
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Possibly lived in groups or flocks
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Member of Ornithomimidae, related to other “ostrich-like” dinosaurs like Struthiomimus and Ornithomimus

dinosaurs.name: Spinosaurus
dinosaurs.speed: Estimated slow on land but highly adapted for swimming
dinosaurs.special_features: Sail-like dorsal structure, elongated crocodile-like skull, conical teeth for catching fish, semi-aquatic adaptations
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Strong jaws and claws for seizing prey
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Member of Spinosauridae; closely related to Baryonyx and Suchomimus

dinosaurs.name: Baryonyx
dinosaurs.speed: Moderate speed on land; effective swimmer
dinosaurs.special_features: Long, crocodile-like snout with conical teeth; large claws; semi-aquatic adaptations
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Powerful jaws for catching fish; sharp claws for tearing or holding
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Member of Spinosauridae; closely related to Spinosaurus and Suchomimus

dinosaurs.name: Irritator
dinosaurs.speed: Moderate speed on land; effective swimmer
dinosaurs.special_features: Elongated crocodile-like snout with conical teeth; relatively small cranial crest
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Powerful jaws and sharp teeth
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Member of Spinosauridae; closely related to Spinosaurus, Baryonyx, and Suchomimus

dinosaurs.name: Triceratops
dinosaurs.special_features: Large bony frill; three facial horns
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Horns for defense; robust build

dinosaurs.name: Ankylosaurus
dinosaurs.special_features: Covered in bony plates (osteoderms); low wide posture; small leaf-shaped teeth
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: Large club-like tail used for predator defense
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Uncertain; possibly solitary or in small groups
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Member of Ankylosauridae; closely related to Euoplocephalus and other armored dinosaurs

dinosaurs.name: Tyrannosaurus
dinosaurs.diet_type: Carnivore (apex predator; hunted large herbivores like Triceratops and Edmontosaurus)
dinosaurs.special_features: Massive skull (up to 1.5 meters long); powerful bite force (>35,000 N)
dinosaurs.defense_attack_mechanism: One of the strongest bite forces of any land animal; strong legs for short bursts of speed
dinosaurs.fossils_found_in: North America (Montana, South Dakota, Wyoming, Alberta Canada)
dinosaurs.social_behaviour: Debated; possibly solitary or lived in small groups
dinosaurs.evolutionary_relationship: Member of Tyrannosauridae; closely related to Albertosaurus and Gorgosaurus
